# Convert text to lowercase.
    text = text.lower()

    # Split the text into words.
    words = re.split(r'\s+', text)

    # Count the number of punctuation marks in the text.
    punctuation = sum(1 for c in text if c in PUNCTUATION)

    return len(words), punctuation

# Remove all punctuation from the text
    text_without_punctuation = ''.join(char for char in text if char not in PUNCTUATION)

    # Split the text into a list of words
    words = re.findall(r'\w+', text_without_punctuation.lower())

    # Count the number of words in the text and punctuation marks in the text
    n_words = len(words)
    n_punctuation = len(re.findall(r'[^\w\s]', text))

    # Return the count of words and punctuation marks as a tuple
    return n_words, n_punctuation

# Count the number of words and punctuation marks in the input string
    words = text.split()
    punctuation = sum([len(re.findall(r"[" + PUNCTUATION + "]", word)) for word in words])

    # Return the count of words and punctuation marks
    return len(words), punctuation

words = len(re.findall(r'\w+', text))
    punctuations = len(re.findall(r'[\w\.]+', text))
    return words, punctuations

# Remove trailing punctuation from the end of the text
    text = text.rstrip(PUNCTUATION)

    # Split text into a list of words
    words = re.split(r'\W+', text)

    # Count the number of words
    num_words = len(words)

    # Count the number of punctuation marks
    num_punct = sum(text.count(char) for char in PUNCTUATION)

    # Return the results as a tuple
    return (num_words, num_punct)

# Split the input string into words and punctuation marks
    words = re.split("\s+|-|,|'|\"", text)
    punctuation_marks = 0
    for c in text:
        if c in PUNCTUATION:
            punctuation_marks += 1

    # Return the count of words and punctuation marks
    return len(words), punctuation_marks

# Split the text into words and punctuation
    words = text.split()
    punctuation = len(re.findall(r"[!?,.]", text))

    # Count the words and punctuation marks
    word_count = len(words)
    punctuation_count = punctuation

    return word_count, punctuation_count

# Split the string into words and punctuation marks
    words = re.split("\W+", text)
    punctuation = sum([1 for char in text if char in PUNCTUATION])

    # Calculate the total number of words and punctuation marks
    count_words = len(words)
    count_punctuation = punctuation
    return (count_words, count_punctuation)

# Count the number of words
    words = re.findall(r'\w+', text)
    word_count = len(words)

    # Count the number of punctuation marks
    punctuation_count = len([char for char in text if char in PUNCTUATION])

    # Return the result as a tuple
    return (word_count, punctuation_count)

text = text.strip()
    word_count = len(text.split())
    punctuation_count = len(re.findall(r"[,.!?;:]", text))
    return word_count, punctuation_count

word_count = len(text.split())
    punctuation_count = len(re.findall(r'\w+', text))
    return word_count, punctuation_count

words_count = len(re.findall(r'\w+', text))
    punctuation_count = len(re.findall(r'[^\w\s]', text))
    return words_count, punctuation_count

words = len(re.findall(r'\w+', text))
    punctuation = len(re.findall(r'[\w\.\']+', text)) - len(re.findall(r'\w+', text))
    return words, punctuation

text = text.lower()
    words = re.findall(r'\w+', text)
    punctuation = re.findall(r'[^\w\s]', text)
    return len(words), len(punctuation)

# Split the string into words and punctuation marks
    words = text.split()
    punctuation = sum(len(word) for word in text.split() if len(word) > 1)

    # Count the number of words and punctuation marks
    word_count = len(words)
    punct_count = punctuation

    # Return the results as a tuple
    return (word_count, punct_count)

words_count = len(text.split())
    punctuation_marks_count = len(re.findall(r'[\w\d]+', text)) - 1
    return words_count, punctuation_marks_count

# Initialize counters for words and punctuation marks
    n_words = 0
    n_punct = 0

    # Split the input text into words and punctuation marks
    words = re.split(r'\W+', text)
    punctuation = re.findall(r'[\w\s]+', text)
    punctuation.extend(text)

    # Count words and punctuation marks
    for word in words:
        word = re.sub(r'\d+', ' ', word).strip()
        if word != ' ':
            n_words += 1
    for p in punctuation:
        if p != ' ':
            n_punct += 1

    return n_words, n_punct

# Count words
    word_count = len(text.split())

    # Count punctuation
    punct_count = len(re.findall(r"[!?,.]", text))

    return word_count, punct_count

text = text.strip()
    text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text)
    words = len(text.split())
    punctuation = len(text) - words
    return words, punctuation

# Split the input string into words and punctuation marks
    words = set(text.split())
    punctuation_marks = set(PUNCTUATION.split(" "))

    # Count the number of words and punctuation marks
    word_count = len(words)
    punctuation_count = len(punctuation_marks)

    return word_count, punctuation_count

# Count the number of words and punctuation marks in the input string
    num_words = len(text.split())
    num_punctuation = sum(text.count(char) for char in PUNCTUATION)

    return num_words, num_punctuation
